content:
Action:2

I'm moving right to advance from my current position toward the exit, expecting that this will shift my avatar to (1,2) and allow me to continue navigating the maze safely.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (1,2) to (1,3) to begin advancing towards the exit, following the planned safe path through free floor tiles.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (1,3) to push the box at (1,4) onto an open floor (1,5), which moves me closer to the exit while following the plan to gradually progress through the maze.

Action:3

I'm moving the avatar down from (1,4) to (2,4) to open up a pathway toward the exit while keeping a safe distance from the boxes and holes.

Action:3

I'm moving the avatar down from row 2 to row 3 (positioning at row3, col4), which is a safe floor and sets up an approach route toward the exit. Let's see if this aligns with our strategy.

Action:2

I'm moving right toward an open corridor that could lead me closer to the exit, expecting my avatar to advance from (3,4) to (3,5) in line with the planned strategy.

Action:1

I'm moving left from (3,5) to (3,4) to start approaching the open passage at column 3 that leads safely downward, which aligns with the strategy.

Action:1

I'm choosing to move left from (3,4) to (3,3) since that free cell aligns with our plan of heading down through row4's only gap (at col3) toward the exit.

Action:3

Moving down from (3,3) to (4,3) is the only safe downward path, setting the stage to push the box later and head toward the exit.

Action:4

I'm moving up so the avatar can enter an open corridor (row3, col3) and plan a path towards the exit, avoiding the walls immediately surrounding the avatar.

Action:3

I'm moving down from (3,3) to (4,3) to head toward the exit, expecting that this advances my position closer to the goal while keeping the path clear.

Action:3

I'm moving down from (4,3), which will push the box at (5,3) into (6,3) so that I can occupy (5,3) and start working towards a path that leads to the exit at (7,11).

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,3) to (5,4), starting along the safe corridor toward the exit and preparing to eventually push the box if needed for a clear path.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,4) to (5,5) on an empty floor tile to progress toward the exit while carefully planning my route.

Action:3

I'm moving the avatar down from (5,5) to (6,5) to start a path that avoids the dangerous hole above and positions us better for navigating toward the exit.

Action:2

I'm moving right from the avatar's current position (6,5) to (6,6) to progress toward the exit, expecting to keep a clear path while avoiding obstacles.

Action:3

I'm moving the avatar down from (6,6) to (7,6) since that cell is free, advancing us along a planned route toward the exit without any immediate obstacles.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (7,6) to (7,7) on an empty floor cell, so I expect to be in position to confront the box in front of the exit later while keeping a safe route.

Action:2

I’m pushing right from row7, col7 so that the box at col8 bounces into the hole (which removes it), and I expect my avatar to advance into col8—clearing the way for a safer route to eventually reach the exit.

Action:4

I'm moving up from (7,8) to (6,8) to head toward an alternate path via row5 that avoids the deadly hole at (7,9) and leads safely to the exit at (7,11).

Action:4

I'm moving UP from (6,8) to (5,8) on a safe floor tile, which sets me on a planned route toward the exit while avoiding dangerous boxes and holes.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,8) to (5,9) because the adjacent cell is an open floor tile, which should safely progress me toward the exit at (7,11).

Action:2

I’m moving right from the avatar’s current position at (5,9) to advance along a clear path toward the exit at (7,11), expecting to get closer to reaching the goal.

Action:2

I'm moving right from (5,10) to (5,11), which sets me up to go down toward the exit at (7,11) on my next move.

Action:3

I am moving the avatar down from (5,11) toward the exit at (7,11), expecting to progress one step closer to our goal while keeping an eye on any necessary rotation adjustments.
